intro: Ranunculus elisae, commonly known as the Elisae buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features delicate, palmate leaves and produces numerous yellow or white petals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
